Class Blade

java.lang.Object
org.interworldtransport.cladosG.Blade
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Blade>
public class Blade extends Object implements Comparable<Blade>
A Blade is essentially an outer product space built from 0 to many vectors. If the vectors aren't parallel, the blade is of higher rank than a vector. At this low level, though, there is no concept of an inner product, thus no sense of 'parallel'. That leaves a blade as an ordered 'set' of distinct directions and a few supporting elements including a long integer key useful for comparisons and byte integer necessary for knowing how many possible directions might ever be added to this blade.

The directions are simply Generators from an enumeration class. They are kept in an EnumSet which uses as its sense of order the same order generators are enumerated in their class. At present, the supported number of 'directions' is 0 to 15, so the enumeration class lists 15 possible generators.

The EnumSet keeps Generators in their natural order. If a new direction is added, the EnumSet will handle it 'late' in the computational sense. In other words, it doesn't matter where the new generator gets added. It matters ONLY when generators are iterated later when establishing a product table or generating a blade key. Iterators will always deliver directions in the same order.

For example, if a sub-manifold has six possible directions from a point, a Blade will contain zero to six of them represented as generators E1 through E6. If only 3 are in the Blade (making it a 3-blade) then ANY three will be in the EnumSet. Perhaps E2, E3, E5. If the EnumSet is empty, zero directions are contained and the blade represents a scalar.

Version:
2.0
Author:
Dr Alfred W Differ

  • Field Details

    • FLIP

      protected static final byte FLIP
      Nothing fancy here. Just giving a name to -1 for use when flipping signs when generators are transposed. This is to make it clear WHY a sign flip occurs. Human readability is the issue.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • Blade

      public Blade(Blade pB)
      This is a copy constructor that builds an identical blade.
      Parameters:
      pB - The Blade to copy

    • Blade

      public Blade(Blade pB, Generator pGen)
      This is a copy constructor that builds an identical blade, but with a maximum generator size just big enough to make room for adding the offered generator.
      IF the new blade would be bigger than the maximum supported size then a copy of pB is constructed instead.
      Parameters:
      pB - The Blade to copy
      pGen - The Generator to add to the list.

    • Blade

      public Blade(byte pMaxGen) throws GeneratorRangeException
      This is a minimal constructor that establishes the blade's future expectations regarding how many generators it might have to add to the set. This one is SO minimal it winds up on its own producing a scalar blade, but with room to expand.
      Parameters:
      pMaxGen - byte integer for the number of possible directions that might appear in this blade.
      Throws:
      GeneratorRangeException - This can happen a few different ways, but the typical one involves making blades with more too many directions. The current maximum is found in CladosConstant.GENERATOR_MAX.

    • Blade

      public Blade(Generator pGen, EnumSet<Generator> pDirs)
      This is a maximal constructor that establishes the blade's future maxGen expectations AND provides an array of directions to load into the blade.
      Parameters:
      pGen - Generator used to get ordinal for the number of possible directions that might appear in this blade.
      pDirs - Contains an enumset of generators to append to the blade.

    • Blade

      public Blade(byte pMaxGen, EnumSet<Generator> pDirs) throws GeneratorRangeException
      This is a maximal constructor that establishes the blade's future maxGen expectations AND provides an array of directions to load into the blade.
      Parameters:
      pMaxGen - byte integer for the number of possible directions that might appear in this blade.
      pDirs - Contains an enumset of generators to append to the blade.
      Throws:
      GeneratorRangeException - This can happen a few different ways, but the typical one involves making blades with too many directions. The current maximum is found in CladosConstant.GENERATOR_MAX.

    • Blade

      public Blade(byte pMaxGen, Generator[] pDirs) throws GeneratorRangeException
      This is a maximal constructor that establishes the blade's future maxGen expectations AND provides an array of directions to load into the blade.
      Parameters:
      pMaxGen - byte integer for the number of possible directions that might appear in this blade.
      pDirs - Generator[] containing directions to append to the blade.
      Throws:
      GeneratorRangeException - This can happen a few different ways, but the typical one involves making blades with more too many directions. The current maximum is found in CladosConstant.GENERATOR_MAX.

    • Blade

      public Blade(Generator pMaxGen)
      Simplest constructor that establishes a Blade by naming directly the largest generator that will ever be used within it. This sets the internal size without having to validate an integer passed in to determine if it is in the supported range because Generator enumeration is assumed ALL supported.
      Parameters:
      pMaxGen - Generator that is the largest of the possible directions that might appear in this blade.

  • Method Details

    • augmentBlade

      public static final Blade augmentBlade(Blade pB, Generator pG)
      This method will try to deliver a Blade with one more generator in its internal set. The new Blade will have its maximum generator ordinal raised by 1 and then all the original generators are added to the set before the offered one is.
      If the new Blade is too big, the old blade is return with no remark. If the old Blade already had the generator, it comes back as a copy but with a higher maximum generator limit. Note that once maxGen is set for a Blade it CANNOT be changed.
      Parameters:
      pB - Blade offered to be augmented.
      pG - Generator offered to be added to pB.
      Returns:
      Blade is returned, but there is a chance it is pB.

    • createBlade

      public static final Blade createBlade(byte pMaxGen)
      Deliver a blade of the size specified by the byte integer... or null.
      A check is made of the parameter that could fail resulting in no blade being returned. If that check fails, a GeneratorRangeException is thrown internally and caught so as to return 'null' instead
      Parameters:
      pMaxGen - This is the byte integer representation of the largest generator that will be used in this blade being created.
      Returns:
      Blade is returned... but it might be null.

    • createOptionalBlade

      public static final Optional<Blade> createOptionalBlade(byte pMaxGen)
      Deliver an optional blade of the size specified by the byte integer.
      A check is made of the parameter that could fail a range test and cause no blade being returned. That's why an Optional of Blade is returned. If the Optional is empty a GeneratorRangeException occurred internally, making it possible for the caller to adapt what they do during runtime.
      Parameters:
      pMaxGen - This is the byte integer representation of the largest genertor that will be used in this blade being created.
      Returns:
      Optional of Blade is returned.

    • createBlade

      public static final Blade createBlade(Blade pB)
      This method is very similar to createBlade(byte) but because it uses an full Blade it can bypass the safety check for support validity. The Generator enumeration is assumed to have ONLY generators that can be supported by internal representations of blades, bases, and products.
      Parameters:
      pB - This is the Blade that will be copied.
      Returns:
      Blade that references all the same generators as the offered one.

    • createBlade

      public static final Blade createBlade(Generator pGen)
      This method is very similar to createBlade(byte) but because it uses an actual generator it can bypass the safety check for support validity. The Generator enumeration is assumed to have ONLY generators that can be supported by internal representations of blades, bases, and products.
      Parameters:
      pGen - This points to the highest generator that could be used.
      Returns:
      Blade with one generator contained and a max set at the same generator.

    • createPScalarBlade

      public static final Blade createPScalarBlade(Generator pGen)
      This method is very similar to createPScalarBlade(byte) but because it uses an actual generator it can bypass the safety check for support validity. The Generator enumeration is assumed to have ONLY generators that can be supported by internal representations of blades, bases, and products.
      Parameters:
      pGen - This points to the highest generator that could be used.
      Returns:
      Blade with all generators contained. Basically, a pscalar in the implied space.

    • createScalarBlade

      public static final Blade createScalarBlade(Generator pGen)
      This is a specialty name that does the same thing as createBlade(gen), but allows for humans to correctly read the intent of a developer when the result Blade is expected to be a scalar.
      Parameters:
      pGen - This points to the highest generator that could be used.
      Returns:
      Blade with no generators contained. Basically, a scalar in the implied space.

    • isNBlade

      public static final boolean isNBlade(Blade blade, byte n)
      Simple grade tester. Does the Blade contain 'n' generators?
      Parameters:
      blade - Blade to be tested
      n - grade value
      Returns:
      TRUE if the blade has a number of generators matching the grade value being tested. FALSE otherwise.

    • isPScalar

      public static final boolean isPScalar(Blade blade)
      Simple grade tester. Does the Blade contain ALL generators for the implied container basis?
      The maximum generator of the implied space could be ZERO causing scalars and pscalars to be the same. This method will return TRUE in that case too.
      Parameters:
      blade - Blade to be tested
      Returns:
      TRUE if the blade all the generators implied by its own maxGen value. FALSE otherwise.

    • isScalar

      public static final boolean isScalar(Blade blade)
      Simple grade tester. Does the Blade contain NO generators?
      The maximum generator of the implied space could be ZERO causing scalars and pscalars to be the same. This method will return TRUE in that case too.
      Parameters:
      blade - Blade to be tested
      Returns:
      TRUE if the blade has no generators. FALSE otherwise.

    • toXMLOrdString

      public static final String toXMLOrdString(Blade blade, String indent)
      This method produces a printable and parseable string that represents the Blade in a human readable form.
      This variation uses a Generator's ordinal to name it in the generator list.
      Parameters:
      blade - The Blade to be exported to XML.
      indent - String of 'tab' characters that help space the output correctly visually. It's not actually necessary except for human readability of the output.
      Returns:
      String The XML formated String representing the Blade.

    • toXMLString

      public static final String toXMLString(Blade blade, String indent)
      This method produces a printable and parseable string that represents the Blade in a human readable form.
      This variation uses a Generator's name in the generator list.
      Parameters:
      blade - The Blade to be exported to XML.
      indent - String of 'tab' characters that help space the output correctly visually. It's not actually necessary except for human readability of the output.
      Returns:
      String The XML formated String representing the Blade.

    • add

      public Blade add(EnumSet<Generator> pS)
      This 'add' method assumes an entire enumerated set of generators has been produced elsewhere and all of the set elements are to be added to this blade.
      A check is performed first to see if the blade is already a pscalar. If it is, it silently returns and does nothing. If it isn't, the method tries to add all set elements even if doing so might make the blade a pscalar along the way. Because the blade's internal representation relies on an EnumSet, it de-duplicates generators added here.
      Parameters:
      pS - An EnumSet of Generators to add to this blade
      Returns:
      this blade

    • add

      public Blade add(Generator pS)
      The generator represents a 'direction' in the blade to be added. The blade is checked to see if it is at maximum size and whether the offered generator is beyond masGrade. If either fails, the add silently returns the Blade unchanged. If both pass, the generator is added to the set.
      Parameters:
      pS - Generator that will be added to the set.
      Returns:
      Blade The blade itself is returned to support stream calls.

    • add

      public Blade add(Generator[] pS)
      The generators represent 'directions' in the blade to be added. The blade is checked to see if it is at maximum size. If it is, the add silently returns the Blade unchanged. If it passes, the generators are added to the set if they pass through the filter that blocks generators larger than maxGen.
      Parameters:
      pS - Generators that will be added to the set.
      Returns:
      Blade The blade itself is returned to support stream calls.

    • bitKey

      public int bitKey()
      This is just a getter method named to support consumers at the end of streams of blades. This is how one gets a stream of blade keys.
      Returns:
      key Returns the blade's bit integer key.

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Blade pIn)
      The method needs to be as efficient as possible because it is used in comparators. It determines the sort order of blades in a basis, thus the streaming order for coefficients in a Scale.
      This function is WHY Blades keep a Long key. The bit key suffices to distinguish blades, but not to sort them into grades in a basis.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Blade>
      Parameters:
      pIn - Blade to be compared to this one
      Returns:
      int in {-1, 0, 1} depending on the size of the offered blade's long integer key relative to this one. If the incoming long key is larger the integer returned is +1.

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object

    • equalsAbs

      public boolean equalsAbs(Object obj)
      This method is very similar to the base object's equality test. The difference is the sign of the blade is not checked. As long as blades are being tested, all that is needed to pass this test is for them to have the same key and maxGen values.
      Parameters:
      obj - The object to test
      Returns:
      boolean True implies two blades are equal to within a sign while False implies they aren't equal even when signs are ignored.

    • get

      public Optional<Generator> get(Generator pG)
      This method essentially tests whether a particular generator is present in the blade, but reports the fact with an Optional instead of a boolean. If the generator is present, the optional is engaged. If not, the optional is disengaged.
      Parameters:
      pG - The Generator to 'get'.
      Returns:
      an Optional of the Generator requested.

    • getGenerators

      protected EnumSet<Generator> getGenerators()
      This is just a getter method named to support calls from within streams.
      Returns:
      key Returns the blade's ArrayList of boxed bytes.

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class Object

    • key

      public long key()
      This is just a getter method named to support consumers at the end of streams of blades. This is how one gets a stream of blade keys.
      Returns:
      key Returns the blade's long integer key.

    • maxGenerator

      public byte maxGenerator()
      This is a gettor for the maximum generator that can be placed in this blade.
      Returns:
      byte integer that would be the ordinal of the largest Generator that could be placed in this blade.

    • rank

      public byte rank()
      This method reports the size of the EnumSet of generators that represents this blade. This is the 'rank' of the blade.
      Returns:
      byte integer number of generators involved in this blade.

    • remove

      public Blade remove(EnumSet<Generator> pS)
      This 'remove' method assumes an entire enumerated set of generators has been produced elsewhere and all of the set elements are to be removed from this blade.
      A check is performed first to see if the blade is already a scalar. If it is, it silently returns and does nothing. If it isn't, the method tries to remove all set elements even if doing so might make the blade a scalar along the way. Because the blade's internal representation relies on an EnumSet, it won't object to attempts to remove set elements not present in the set. Trying is inefficient, but does no harm.
      Parameters:
      pS - An EnumSet of Generators to remove from this blade
      Returns:
      this blade

    • remove

      public Blade remove(Generator pS)
      The generator represents a 'direction' in the blade to be removed. If anything is found to be removed, the key is recomputed.
      Parameters:
      pS - Generator representing the 'direction' to remove from the blade.
      Returns:
      Blade The blade itself is returned to support stream calls.

    • reverse

      public Blade reverse()
      Flip the order of multiplication of the generators. This doesn't actually alter the EnumSet containing generators, though. It computes the effect of a reversal as a sign flip since the effect is to scale the blade by +1 or -1.
      No Sign flip for blade size = 0, 1, 4, 5, 8, 9, Sign flip for blade.size = 2, 3, 6, 7,
      No Sign flip for blade.size()/2 = 0, 2, 4, Sign flip for blade.size()/2 = 1, 3,
      So sign flips when (blade.size()/2) %2 == 1
      Returns:
      Blade This one after the action is complete. Supporting streams.

    • sign

      public byte sign()
      A simple gettor for the sign of the blade
      Returns:
      byte integer represeting the sign. Should be +1 or -1.

    • setSign

      protected Blade setSign(byte pSign)
      Simple settor for the sign of this blade.
      Parameters:
      pSign - byte integer should be +1, -1, or 0. If it isn't, sign is set to 0.
      Returns:
      this blade
